item.title: Configuring and listening to webhook using Box Developer and Google Sheets
item.author: juliana.spector@water.ca.gov (Juliana Spector)
item.description: What is a webhook? Webhooks are user-defined HTTP callbacks that are triggered by some event, such as pushing code to a repository or a comment being posted to a blog. When that event occurs, the source site makes an HTTP request to the URL configured for the webhook. In my case, I wanted to enable a callback when a file was uploaded to a Box folder owned by my organization.
